Earth observation data obtained from remote sensing is effective for evaluations of vegetation cover, vigor, growth dynamics, and many other applications. The indices used in the application are the Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI), Normalized Difference Water Index (NDWI), Normalized Difference Moisture Index (NDMI), Enhanced Vegetation Index (EVI), and a 2-band EVI (EVI2). These can provide extremely useful information for environmental monitoring, biodiversity conservation, agriculture, forestry, urban green infrastructures, and other related fields.
 For information about Servir and how they use this Earth Observation data, visit 
 https://servirglobal.net
